image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: A do not cross police crime scene tape strewn across a suburban road

props.synopsis: A 51-year-old Seaton man has been charged with manslaughter after police say they were called to a fight on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Man dies, another charged after alleged fight in Adelaide's western suburbs, police say

image.altText: A man standing in front of a water truck.

props.synopsis: South Australia's farmers are worried about water supplies for livestock as drought conditions cause dams to dry up across the state.

title.children: Dry dams leave SA farmers deciding to buy water or sell livestock

image.altText: An office building facing a suburban road.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway into the handling of grant funding by past management at one of South Australia's largest disability advocacy services.

title.children: Disability advocacy service under investigation, clients told to 'represent yourself'

image.altText: A man with grey hair and moustache lays in a hospital bed with a woman leaning down with her arm around him

props.synopsis: SA Health officials apologise to a man who waited 15 hours to be seen at an Adelaide emergency department after presenting with a suspected stroke.

title.children: 'It was awful': Man waits 15 hours in Adelaide hospital after suspected stroke

image.altText: Lady with long brown hair, black dress and yellow rainbow earrings stares somber at the camera with a child memorial behind

props.synopsis: When Bronwyn Helgeson's five-year-old son died suddenly, she was left dealing with unimaginable grief and unexpected financial costs.

title.children: Australia 'behind the game' with helping families navigate child loss

image.altText: A dried up dam with cracked soil and little water

props.synopsis: Children are skipping school because families are running out of water to shower or wash uniforms, a South Australian mayor says amid record dry weather in the state.

title.children: 'Dirty uniforms': Families in Adelaide's south face water shortages

image.altText: Lauren Willgoose walks alongside an older woman outside the court

props.synopsis: A former Adelaide lawyer who drank more than a litre of wine before fatally crashing into a pedestrian has been jailed for eight years.

title.children: Former lawyer jailed over hit-run that killed pedestrian

image.altText: pension money

props.synopsis: There will likely be a flurry of insurance claims lodged after Cyclone Alfred, so here's what the experts recommend you do before, during and after the storm to make sure you're protected.

title.children: How to prepare for Cyclone Alfred insurance claims

image.altText: Man and his son load sand into bags at Logan collection centre

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have visited sandbag collection areas across Logan just to help other residents.

title.children: Community rallies to help each other as Alfred looms

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at a lecturn in the national situation room. weather maps are on screens behind him

props.synopsis: The cyclone will be a passing disruptor, but the disruption from the Trump administration will be with Australia (and the world) for the foreseeable future.

title.children: Cyclones pass, but Trump is here to disrupt for the foreseeable future

image.altText: Man in red hat stands in spiral staircase

props.synopsis: After decades of cultural division over the date chosen to celebrate Australia Day, hip hop artist Rulla Kelly-Mansell proposes a different date that marks one of the most unifying moments in the country's history.

title.children: Rapper's quest to 'find the date' prompts bold proposal for Australia Day

image.altText: Calcified tree roots in a cave.

props.synopsis: The Munro Karst system in South Australia's south-east could be 2 million years old and may contain rare fossils.

title.children: Push to have ancient cave system added to SA heritage list

image.altText: The mangled remains of a freight train after a crash with a truck in the outback.

props.synopsis: Mick Warren and Kevin Baker died on New Year's Eve 2023 when their train collided with a truck at a level crossing near the SA-NSW border.

title.children: Truck driver pleads not guilty over deadly crash with freight train

image.altText: Barristers leaving a Queensland Supreme Court courtroom

props.synopsis: The Australian Law Reform Commission set out to try and address the strikingly low rate of reporting of sexual offences and even lower rates of prosecution and convictions.

title.children: Sweeping changes recommended for how sexual violence is handled by courts

image.altText: Rocky hills surrounding a flattish plain. The rocks and dirt are red. Small shrubs are scattered around.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 3.47-billion-year-old crater in WA's Pilbara region pushes back the age of the earliest-known impact site on Earth by more than one billion years.

title.children: Earth's oldest-known impact crater discovered in outback WA

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: The estranged wife of AFL player Rick Olarenshaw and an Australian couple were arrested last year during separate raids on spas that Balinese police said were  "providing pornographic services".

title.children: Influencer and Aussie couple sentenced to seven months for illegal Bali spas

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks outside the Queensland emergency services complex

props.synopsis: The leaders of the major parties are acutely aware that a misstep when responding to a natural disaster can have major political consequences.

title.children: As a cyclone approaches his electorate, Dutton quietly attends a Sydney fundraiser

image.altText: South Korean KF-16 fighter jets fly in the sky

props.synopsis: South Korea's Air Force say eight 225kg Mk82 bombs from KF-16 jets fell during military exercises in Pocheon.

title.children: South Korea air force jets accidentally drop bombs on homes

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks at a lectern

props.synopsis: High Commissioner Phil Goff has lost his job for comments in which he appeared to question US President Donald Trump's grasp of history.

title.children: NZ sacks high commissioner to UK over comments critical of Trump

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A view of soldiers in army gear from behind with firey shots ahead of them from cannon.

props.synopsis: One expert says the CIA's move to stop sharing intelligence with Ukraine will have an instantaneous impact on the battlefield. Here's what we know.

title.children: What we know about the US decision to cut intelligence sharing with Ukraine

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump, who wears a suit and US flag pin and glances sideways.

props.synopsis: As Democrats heckled and Republicans cheered, four robed figures sat silently through Donald Trump's speech. They could form part of his biggest barrier.

title.children: While Democrats heckled, Trump's biggest obstacles sat quietly

image.altText: a sign that reads closed until further notice stay safe hangs outside a shop in lismore as the town prepares for cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: Three years after Lismore was devastated by record-breaking floods, residents were again forced to leave their homes.

title.children: NSW premier pleads with Northern Rivers residents to heed evacuation orders

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Jurors were shown the location where Toyah Cordingley's body was found before hearing evidence from witnesses who say they saw a man behaving strangely at the scene.

title.children: Court hears of 'suspicious' man on beach before Toyah Cordingley's death

image.altText: A mass of people dance under backlit colourful sails in the middle of the bush scrub

props.synopsis: The Esoteric Musical Festival in north-west Victoria has been cancelled at the last minute after its permit application was knocked back by the local council's building surveyor.

title.children: Esoteric Festival organisers 'gutted' at last-minute event cancellation

image.altText: A man gives a cow lying on the ground a drink of water from a water bottle.

props.synopsis: Dead and injured cattle from an overturned livestock truck were ignored by authorities for weeks while multiple state government agencies, councils, and insurance companies bickered over who was responsible.

title.children: Response to cattle truck rollover branded a bureaucratic 'balls-up'

image.altText: Two people stand behind podiums and microphones

props.synopsis: As WA's election day nears, the campaign has grown increasingly bumpy for both Labor and the Liberals with some unwanted distractions.

title.children: The attack dogs are out in the final week of the WA election campaign

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Cabinet January 2025

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump's pick to lead US Pentagon policy expressed concern over Australia's low defence spend. The prime minister insists significant investment has been made and defence spending will continue to rise.

title.children: Albanese responds to Trump camp 'concern' on Australia's defence spend

image.altText: A close-up shot of a policeman wearing badges

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police Commissioner Michael Murphy is the senior public official found by the NT's corruption watchdog to have engaged in improper conduct.

title.children: NT police commissioner outs himself as subject of anti-corruption probe

image.altText: Fred Stolle holds a trophy

props.synopsis: Fred Stolle, who won two grand slam singles titles and was a three-time Davis Cup champion for Australia during the nation's greatest era of tennis, has died aged 86.

title.children: Grand slam, Davis Cup winner and commentary legend Stolle dies aged 86

image.altText: A man with white hair and beard wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: An industrial manslaughter prosecution over the death of a Darwin construction worker in 2020 could be over before it begins after NT WorkSafe failed to turn over hundreds of documents.

title.children: 'Cluster of epic proportions': Industrial manslaughter prosecution derailed

image.altText: Man with black hair and beard wears yellow shirt and smiles looking off to side.

props.synopsis: The vibraphone player and producer is one of the most sampled artists in popular music.

title.children: Influential funk legend Roy Ayers has died — these 5 songs will live forever

image.altText: A Tasmanian devil hunched near a residential toilet

props.synopsis: A snake catcher uses tactics usually reserved for unwanted reptiles after a Tasmanian devil took shelter from pursuing dogs behind a toilet — while a woman was sitting down.

title.children: Tasmanian devil gives woman on toilet a big surprise
